faq.title: Have Questions?
faq.subtitle: Here are the most frequently asked questions.
faq.a1: Yes, you can use it completely free for up to 50 people. No credit card required. For larger groups, paid plans are available.
faq.a2: For rosters, we support Excel (.xlsx, .xls) and CSV files. For design templates, you can upload JPG and PNG images.
faq.q3: Can I adjust the nametag size?
faq.a3: Yes, we support various sizes from business card size (90x50mm) to large badges (100x150mm). You can also enter custom dimensions.
faq.q4: How many nametags can I create at once?
faq.a4: Free plan allows up to 50 people, while paid plans have no limits. Hundreds of nametags can be generated as PDF in seconds.
faq.q5: Can I apply different designs per role?
faq.a5: Yes, you can automatically apply different designs or colors based on a specific column in your roster (e.g., job title, department).

section1.title: 1. Purpose of Processing Personal Information
section1.content: NameTag Pro (hereinafter referred to as 'Service') processes the minimum necessary personal information to provide the nametag generation service. The Service uses the roster data uploaded by users solely for the purpose of generating nametags and does not store it on our servers.

section2.title: 2. Personal Information Collected
section2.content: The Service processes the following personal information:
section2.item1: Roster data: Name, affiliation, title, and other information uploaded by users (processed only in the browser, not stored on servers)
section2.item2: Service usage records: Access logs, browser information (for service improvement purposes)
section2.item3: Cookies: Storing user preferences such as language settings

section3.title: 3. Processing and Retention Period
section3.content: Roster data is processed only in the user's browser and is not transmitted to or stored on our servers. All data is deleted when the browser is closed or the page is refreshed. Service usage records may be collected in anonymized form for service improvement and are retained for one year from the date of collection before being destroyed.

section4.title: 4. Disclosure to Third Parties
section4.content: The Service does not provide users' personal information to third parties. However, personal information may be provided in accordance with applicable laws when required by law.

section5.title: 5. Destruction of Personal Information
section5.content: Roster data is processed in the browser, so no separate destruction procedure is required. It is automatically deleted when the user closes the browser or navigates away from the page. Service usage records stored on servers are destroyed without delay when the retention period expires.

section6.title: 6. Rights of Data Subjects
section6.content: Users may request access to, correction of, deletion of, or suspension of processing of their personal information at any time. For roster data, users can manage it directly as it is only processed in the browser.

section7.title: 7. Use of Cookies
section7.content: The Service uses cookies to enhance user experience. Cookies are used to store user preferences such as language settings. Users may refuse to use cookies through browser settings, but this may limit the use of the Service.
